alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fillmore; Hamilton; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 03 at 5:58PM CDT until October 03 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN CLAY...NORTHEASTERN ADAMS...SOUTHWESTERN YORK...HAMILTON AND NORTHWESTERN FILLMORE COUNTIES... At 558 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Giltner, or 16 miles northeast of Hastings, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Aurora around 610 PM CDT. Hampton around 615 PM CDT. Bradshaw around 620 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 324 and 349. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
